entry.title: Debate: 64 bytes in OP_RETURN VS taproot OP_FALSE OP_IF OP_PUSH
entry.summary: The discussion revolves around setting a limit for bitcoin transactions nodejs module. The initial limit, according to the specifications, was 512B. The task of setting a new limit is not a fork and is easy to do. The need for a new limit arises because Bitcoin's IF/ENDIF "unlimited" storage rule mimics Ethereum, which is not ideal. Christopher Allen suggests setting the limit at 520, as it is similar to taproot's limit. However, there are other factors to consider when deciding on a limit.
